com.tealium.library

Class Tealium.Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tealium.library.Tealium.Config
  • Enclosing class:
    Tealium

    public static final class Tealium.Config
extends java.lang.Object

    Class used to initialize the Tealium Library.

    This class' various setters return a reference to itself, so those methods can be chained.

    Since:
    2014-06-23
    Version:
    3.0

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ACCEL_SENSITIVITY

        public static final float DEFAULT_ACCEL_SENSITIVITY

        Unit-less acceleration threshold for the SensorListener. For most devices tested, this value was the not-too-many/not-too-few shake threshold.

        Its value is 3.75

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Tealium.Config create(Application application,
                    java.lang.String accountName,
                    java.lang.String profileName,
                    java.lang.String environmentName)

        Factory method to create a Tealium.Config object or null based on given parameters. All of these fields are required to successfully instantiate the Tealium.Config, otherwise null is returned.

        Parameters:
        application - - the current application object, this can be retrieved by Activity#getApplication().
        accountName - - name of this Tealium account, such as "tealiummobile".
        profileName - - name of this project's profile, such as "demo".
        environmentName - - name of this project's target environment. Conventionally this is "dev", "qa", or "prod".
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config instance or null.

      • create

        public static Tealium.Config create(Activity activity,
                    java.lang.String accountName,
                    java.lang.String profileName,
                    java.lang.String environmentName)

        Factory method to create a Tealium.Config object or null based on given parameters. All of these fields are required to successfully instantiate the Tealium.Config, otherwise null is returned.

        Parameters:
        activity - - the current Activity.
        accountName - - name of this Tealium account, such as "tealiummobile".
        profileName - - name of this project's profile, such as "demo".
        environmentName - - name of this project's target environment. Conventionally this is "dev", "qa", or "prod".
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config instance or null.

      • setLibraryLogLevel

        public Tealium.Config setLibraryLogLevel(Tealium.LogLevel level)

        Sets the log level for all of the Tealium Library LogCat messages.

        Tealium.LogLevel.VERBOSE logs for all messages, and Tealium.LogLevel.SILENT silences all messages.Tealium.LogLevel.WARN is the default.

        Parameters:
        level - - a Tealium.LogLevel value, if given null, no change occurs.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

      • setJavaScriptLogLevel

        public Tealium.Config setJavaScriptLogLevel(Tealium.LogLevel level)

        The Tealium Library leverages JavaScript to normalize and dynamically process TealiumIQ configuration. This method sets the log level for all of the Tealium Library's JavaScript operations' LogCat messages.

        All logs generated in JavaScript will print according to the level defined here.

        Parameters:
        level - - a Tealium.LogLevel value, if given null, no change occurs.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

      • setHTTPSEnabled

        public Tealium.Config setHTTPSEnabled(boolean isEnabled)

        Sets whether tags are fetched using HTTP or HTTPS, and whether SSL errors are ignored.

        Parameters:
        disabled - - when true, tags are fetched using HTTP and SSL errors are ignored. When false, HTTPS is used to fetch tags and SSL errors will stop communication.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

      • setCrashTrackingEnabled

        public Tealium.Config setCrashTrackingEnabled(boolean isEnabled)

        This method sets whether the Tealium Library sets its own Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler for crash tracking. If false; the library sets itself, and if a crash event occurs, calls the original handler.

        Parameters:
        disabled - - When true Tealium WILL NOT set Thread.setUncaughtExceptionHandler(java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler) with its own handler.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

      • setMobileHtmlUrlOverride

        public Tealium.Config setMobileHtmlUrlOverride(java.lang.String newUrl)

        Set the location for which TealiumIQ data us fetched, the default is automatically generated using the account/profile information.

        Parameters:
        newUrl - - Complete url, if given null; no changes occur.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

      • setAccelerationSensitivity

        public Tealium.Config setAccelerationSensitivity(float sensitivity)

        Full Library Feature. This value has no consequence in the compact library.

        Set a unit-less acceleration threshold for the SensorListener. Its default value is DEFAULT_ACCEL_SENSITIVITY

        Parameters:
        float - some value greater than 0. If less than or equal to 0, no change occurs.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

      • addGlobalCustomData

        public Tealium.Config addGlobalCustomData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data)

        Add custom data to be fired off with all tracking dispatches. Utilizing this method ensures that initial dispatches will have the desired data.

        Parameters:
        data - - Data to add to the Tealium.getGlobalCustomData() data. When null, no change occurs.
        Returns:
        Tealium.Config - a reference to this instance for method chaining.

        public java.lang.String toString()

        Assembles a String of the current state of the Tealium.Config.
